'Val Allen Browning' (August 20, 1895 â May 16, 1994) was an American
industrialist, philanthropist and third generation gun innovator. His
grandfather, Jonathan Browning, opened a gun shop in Ogden, Utah in 1852 and his
father, John Browning, is considered by many to be the most important gun
inventor in history.
